# swagger-java-client

My REST API
- API version: 1.0.0
  - Build date: 2019-04-10T13:47:23.478Z

about employee & addresses

  For more information, please visit [https://www.epam.com/](https://www.epam.com/)

*Automatically generated by the [Swagger Codegen](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-codegen)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.7+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
  <artifactId>swagger-java-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.swagger:swagger-java-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/swagger-java-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

import io.swagger.client.*;
import io.swagger.client.auth.*;
import io.swagger.client.model.*;
import io.swagger.client.api.AddressControllerApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class AddressControllerApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        
        AddressControllerApi apiInstance = new AddressControllerApi();
        Address address = new Address(); // Address | address
        Long employeeId = 789L; // Long | employeeId
        try {
            Address result = apiInstance.createAddressUsingPOST(address, employeeId);
            System.out.println(result);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling AddressControllerApi#createAddressUsingPOST");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to *https://localhost:8080*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*AddressControllerApi* | [**createAddressUsingPOST**](docs/AddressControllerApi.md#createAddressUsingPOST) | **POST** /employees/{employeeId}/addresses | create new address
*AddressControllerApi* | [**getAllAddressesByEmployeeIdUsingGET**](docs/AddressControllerApi.md#getAllAddressesByEmployeeIdUsingGET) | **GET** /employees/{employeeId}/addresses | get all addresses by employee id
*EmployeeControllerApi* | [**allUsingGET**](docs/EmployeeControllerApi.md#allUsingGET) | **GET** /employees | get all employees
*EmployeeControllerApi* | [**newEmployeeUsingPOST**](docs/EmployeeControllerApi.md#newEmployeeUsingPOST) | **POST** /employees | create new employee
*EmployeeControllerApi* | [**oneUsingGET**](docs/EmployeeControllerApi.md#oneUsingGET) | **GET** /employees/{id} | get information about employee by id

## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
